results.neighborhood_overview: It can be said without hesitation that this flat enjoys the best location on offer for a holiday in Madrid. Practically a stone's throw away from Madrid's 3 most important art galleries (Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia), it straddles the historic Barrio de las Letras and the Huertas Neighbourhoods with their cultural offer and bustling nightlife, while being a 5 minute walk away from Madrid’s famous Retiro Park and 10 minutes from walk from the Puerta del Sol. The street itself is beautiful, lined with bars, restaurants and taverns but the flat is very quiet at night. All of central Madrid (Sol, Gran Via, Lavapies, Plaza Mayor) is within walking distance from the flat..

results.name: Private Room in a Sunny and Luxuriously Appointed Apartment
results.description:
Set a traditional dining table and enjoy a delicious homemade breakfast. Choose a book from a glass cabinet afterwards, and read on an inviting couch or in bed. Catch up on email on a computer by a picture window with views of a quiet neighborhood.

In a quiet area of the city of Madrid (Arturo Soria neighborhood), just 15 minutes from IFEMA and 20 minutes from the airport by metro, I rent a private room with bathroom in a 90 m2 (1000 ft) flat.

It looks onto a private garden and swimming pool which ou can enjoy during your stay in Madrid. WiFi and free national landline calls are included.

If you are planning to stay for a long period of time (more than a week) washing clothes (but not ironing!) and room/bathroom cleaning are included as well.

Metro entrance is just 1 minute walk from the building (line 4-ESPERANZA stop) and 3 minutes walk you can find buses number 120 and 122. You can get to the historic center less than half an hour.
results.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the peaceful Arturo Soria neighborhood. Entrance to the Metro is a 1-minute walk. Reach the historic center of Madrid in less than half an hour.
results.host_about:
Soy una persona tranquila, amante de la calma y el orden. Me gusta cocinar, la jardinería y disfrutar de la vida junto a mi familia y amigos.

He vivido en Estados Unidos y el Reino Unido por lo que me siento muy a fin con la cultura anglosajona. Me gusta conocer gente de todo el mundo porque es la manera más directa y bonita de aprender. Siempre que puedo me escapo a algún rincón en el extranjero para conocer nuevos lugares y culturas.

Si todos cumplimos unas mínimas normas de convivencia esta resulta genial. Me encantará ayudarte a orientarte sobre que lugares y rincones debes visitar en Madrid, sobre todo esos que los que vivimos en la ciudad visitamos y que normalmente los turistas no conocen :-)

results.neighborhood_overview:
The nickname -Malasaña- neighborhood will come following the street dedicated in 1879 to the family and since 1961 Malasaña young seamstress Manuela Malasaña, killed by Napoleon's troops during the days of repression subsequent to the lifting of May 2, 1808 on charges of "bear arms" to bring a sewing scissors when she was arrested. His body was buried in the Hospital of the Good Bliss on the street Silva.
At the heart of the neighborhood is Plaza Dos de Mayo, which was the former site of Artillery Monteleón, where they were quartered against "francesada" the little military force that took up arms against the Napoleonic army, under the command two captains Pedro Velarde and Luis Daoiz. In the remodeled square arch of old barracks it remains. Other typical neighborhood squares are, for example, San Ildefonso and Santa Maria Soledad Torres Acosta.
Like many other central areas of Madrid Maravillas district it has enough alternative atmosphere and nightlife. Some chroniclers hav

results.neighborhood_overview:
Just a few meters away from Gran Via Metro Station and about 5 minutes walking from the city's "0 kilometer" in the Puerta del Sol. Absolute centre of the capital, the most historic but also modern, the most tourist but at the same time the most crowded by locals.


A few minutes walk form this apartment is enough to reach the most visited places in the city. Emblematic points such as the Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real and Gran Vía –Madrid's Broadway Street, just one block away-.

Worldwide known museums such as Reina Sofía, Prado or Thyssen Bornemisza, and the main park : El Retiro . Everything within walking distance! And of course this is an area where you'll find the best and most typical restaurants, bars and shops.

The perfect place if you're willing to get to know Madrid's essence.

results.neighborhood_overview:
La Latina / Embajadores
From: https://www.timeout.com/coolest-neighbourhoods-in-the-world
Embajadores
neighbourhoods to visit in 2018
The coolest neighbourhood in the world 2018 is Embajadores, Madrid
Madrid might be the world’s most exciting capital right now, and Embajadores is its most colourful neighbourhood. This is a place where people from near and far live side by side, cooking up a bustling cultural life. To the north, Plaza Tirso de Molina is the territory of florists by day, and at night fills with young revellers queuing to get into Medias Puri, the city’s club of the moment. To the south are Tabacalera and La Casa Encendida, two huge cultural centres standing like transatlantic vessels run ashore in the middle of the city. You can dine on Indian specialities served atop a flowery oilcloth, or get a divine Moroccan lamb tagine for an absurdly low price. Nightlife and street life, street art and high culture, food and people from across the world:

results.name: Great Studio! Best Reviews!
results.description:
Spacious and bright open-plan loft in the heart of Madrid's Malasaña district, located in the center of the city. The loft is equipped with air conditioning and WiFi. With 40 square meters of space and exposed wooden beams at a height of 5 meters, it features a kitchen area, living room, a very comfortable bed, and a small functional bathroom .
This fantastic loft is fully equipped and perfect for couples looking for a comfortable getaway in Madrid.
results.neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the heart of Madrid's central district, known as Malasaña or Madrid's Soho. It is just one block away from the bustling San Ildefonso square, making it one of the trendiest and most exciting areas of this vibrant city. You'll find countless shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters, and more, right at your doorstep.

The building itself is a protected historical landmark from 1890 and is situated on a charming and character-filled street. Despite being centrally located, the space is bright and sunny, yet still quiet and peaceful."

I have  converted my photography and portrait  studio to be used as a self catering loft, with everything you may need. You will be able to sense how this wonderful space is definitely special! 
My own apartment, where I life, is in the same building, so I am always available if there is anything you need or if you have any question. That is very practical because I can always take care of your luggage in case of an early check-in or late check-out.

results.neighborhood_overview:
The nickname -Malasaña- neighborhood will come following the street dedicated in 1879 to the family and since 1961 Malasaña young seamstress Manuela Malasaña, killed by Napoleon's troops during the days of repression subsequent to the lifting of May 2, 1808 on charges of "bear arms" to bring a sewing scissors when she was arrested. His body was buried in the Hospital of the Good Bliss on the street Silva.
At the heart of the neighborhood is Plaza Dos de Mayo, which was the former site of Artillery Monteleón, where they were quartered against "francesada" the little military force that took up arms against the Napoleonic army, under the command two captains Pedro Velarde and Luis Daoiz. In the remodeled square arch of old barracks it remains. Other typical neighborhood squares are, for example, San Ildefonso and Santa Maria Soledad Torres Acosta.

results.neighborhood_overview:
PALACIO NEIGHBORHOOD
Palacio is a neighborhood full of Madrid's grand historic buildings. Busy tapas bars line the arcades of the 17th-century Plaza Mayor. Madrid's 18th-century Royal Palace is famous for its sumptuous furnishings and landscaped gardens. Opera and dance performances are staged at the 19th-century Teatro Real. Nearby, the steps of the baroque Almudena Cathedral are a popular gathering place to watch the sunset.

MADRID
Madrid , Spain capital , is one of the cities that is becoming a very attractive tourist destination for both Spanish and international tourists in recent years.
Beyond the monuments that can be visited in Madrid, the charm that is experienced in its main squares and streets, with landmarks such as the Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol or the reborn Gran Via, is one of its main attractions. But above all those who visit Madrid appreciate the very welcoming spirit of the city, always with a great cultural, leisure and gastronomic atm

results.neighborhood_overview:
Es un barrio de acceso restringido para la circulación, por lo que es necesario solicitar un permiso para entrar. Si vienes en coche, por favor, dímelo y dime tu número de matrícula para que pueda solicitar el permiso. No nos hacemos responsables de las multas.
Es un barrio bohemio y lleno de gente con un potencial creativo maravilloso.
Tiene gran espíritu solidario y no faltan entretenimientos con mucha imaginación.
Tiene un peso cultural muy importante en la vida madrileña tanto por todos los eventos de teatro clásico como de una enorme variedad de teatros alternativos.
Catas de vino, paseos en bici, visitas guiadas…
Es el madrileño barrio de Lavapies, muy famosos por su gran actividad cultural. Es un barrio con una población muy diversa lo que le hace muy interesante.
La "calle del arte" de Europa se encuentra aquí, haty multitud de galerías y salas de exposiciones. Restaurantes con encanto y mercados genuinos.

English:
It is a bohemia

results.neighborhood_overview:
SALIR

Si usted quiere disfrutar de una estancia con lujo y glamour, en una buena zona de Madrid, perfectamente comunicada, este es su apartamento.Además, se encuentra en uno de los múltiples centros de la ciudad de Madrid. A escasos minutos en metro del centro histórico, el apartamento corona la Castellana, una de las vías más populares y con más solera de la ciudad. El apartamento está justo donde se encuentra la ciudad imperial con el nuevo eje de negocios que ahora conforman Plaza Castilla y las torres comerciales. Andando por la Castellana , que se divide en Paseo de la Castellana, Paseo de Recoletos y el Paseo del Prado, vamos viendo cómo convive la tradición con la modernidad.

Desde el imponente edificio de la Biblioteca Nacional, hasta la histórica Cibeles, pasamos, a solo diez minutos andando desde el apartamento, por el Santiago Bernabeu, el glorioso estadio del Real Madrid. Galerías de moda, restaurantes para todos los paladares, terrazas al aire libre
results.host_about:
We are a spanish family of architects and interior designers. We own several apartments in Madrid and Barcelona,  all of them are located in premium areas and are specially adapted for short term rentals for days, weeks or months. 

Our apartments are really special and are full of soul. Suitable for all those who want to enjoy their holidays, feel at home on a business trip, or take advantage of everything the city has to offer due to their exceptional location (something that students thank us a lot for). These are apartments with all the amenities, isolated from noise while being in the very center of the city. Equipped with all the necessities: from WIFI connection, essential for taking advantage of the city and planning the day before leaving home, to a wine-opener to uncork Spanish wine and savor it slowly after a long day. . .

Our way of being brings us closer to the people. We accompany them throughout the whole process, from the moment of booking until the check out. We give them advice according to their preferences and enrich their stay so they can make the most out of the city and, of course, the apartment. We keep them updated  from our weblogs on all the news, events, and dates not to be missed. We have open channels in social networks for consultation and suggestions, and they can benefit from the experience of others who have already enjoyed our services before.

Our apartments are a more human and personal alternative to hotels. The direct and constant attention, as well as a new home in the city makes us your best option.
  
Have a good trip and we hope to see you soon!!!

results.neighborhood_overview:
Malasaña is to the west of Chueca and to the east of Argüelles. It is surrounded by several metro stations and is a central neighbourhood of Madrid. Residents include Esperanza Aguirre, the former Governor of the Province of Madrid, amongst other politicians and several artists. It was the center of the movida movement in late 1970s and 1980s Madrid.

Malasaña is a vibrant neighborhood full of lively bars and clubs overflowing with young people. Its streets are currently being renovated, making it a much more attractive quarter. It's one of the classic areas for partying the night away. The area's center is the Plaza del Dos de Mayo (in commemoration of a popular uprising on May 2, 1808, brutally repressed by the French troops and which started the Spanish Independence War).

Our way of being brings us closer to the people. We accompany them throughout the whole process, from the moment of booking until the check out. We give them advice according to their preferences and enrich their stay so they can make the most out of the city and, of course, the apartment. We keep them updated  from our weblogs on all the news, events, and dates not to be missed. We have open channels in social networks for consultation and suggestions, and they can benefit from the experience of others who have already enjoyed our services before.

Our apartments are a more human and personal alternative to hotels. The direct and constant attention, as well as a new home in the city makes us your best option.
  
Have a good trip and we hope to see you soon!!!

results.neighborhood_overview:
Trendy and full of life, Chueca is at the heart for MADrid lifestyle.

Within walking distance, you can enjoy layback sunset rooftop bars, popular restaurant, bars with cool atmosphere and a sophisticated hipster vibe.

Located in the heart of the city, next to Gran Vía, Chueca is one of the neighbourhood's of Madrid best known internationally for its atmosphere and nightlife. However, the appeal comes on several fronts, and art and history is also one of them.

Chueca hosts the Fernando de Castro Foundation and the Museum of Romanticism, former palace of the Marquis de Matallana built in 1776, which houses an interesting collection of paintings, furniture and decorative arts of the nineteenth century, representative of the cultural, political and daily life of Madrid Romantic (works by Goya, Esquivel, Madrazo, Alenza and the Becquer brothers, among others).

A few meters away, there is the Palace of Longoria, one of the few completely modernis

results.host_about: Mi vivienda habitual era aquí en mi casa de Madrid donde trabaje de lunes a viernes pues mi vida transcurre mucha parte del tiempo en Bilbao. En las jornadas normales, empleo parte de mi tiempo en practicar algún deporte e ir al gimnasio, asistir a cursos, hacer compras o ir al cine. Suelo ausentarme de Madrid con bastante frecuencia, aunque ocasionalmente viene a visitarme mi pareja. Me gusta leer, viajar, la comunicación 2.0, practicar la natación y correr -no más de 10 Km-. visitar museos, asistir a algún concierto o teatro, ir a la Filmoteca, o pasear con parada en un par de bares ;), lo que es fácil en Madrid para mí ya que vivo en el centro y se puede ir caminando a todas partes sin necesidad de coche. Además tengo cuatro estaciones de metro al lado de casa y otras cuatro líneas de autobús  que me dejan en un cuarto de hora en pleno casco antiguo de la ciudad, a lo que añadir biciMAD, sistema público de transporte en bicicleta electrica con tres aparcamientos cerca.

results.name: Central, fully equipped, best price
results.description:
Located in one of the most important and elegant streets in the centre of Madrid, a very few metres away from Bilbao underground station, this interior one-roomed 25m2 apartment is suitable for two people. Very bright, with two interior balconies, in a 4th floor. A lift in the building to facilitate access to the floors.

Wifi.

Hair-dryer, fridge, vitroceramic cooker, oven, washing machine, dishwasher, micro-wave oven, coffee-maker, kettle, toaster and a juicer.

Bedlinen is provided.
results.neighborhood_overview: The area is completely safe and there are plenty of restaurants, cafes, markets, supermarkets, cinemas and all different kind of shops around, so by choosing to stay in such a suitable area, you will certainly assure yourself a convenient and very nice stay in Madrid.
results.host_about: Hola! Soy Marina. Nací en Madrid y soy hija y nieta de madrileños. Adoro mi ciudad y me encantará enseñarte los lugares más emblemáticos que no se deben dejar de visitar en esta ciudad, así como aquellos otros más desconocidos y especiales, que no aparecen en las guías turísticas. Os espero!

results.name: Large single room in Madrid's trending Almagro.
results.description: Very comfortable room in Madrid's central Almagro district, well connected by metro (on the doorstep) and bus and two steps away from the Ponzano Street food scene, la Plaza de Olavide with its lively terraces and the centre of Madrid, wiht la Puerta del Sol only a 15 minute metro ride away on line 1.
results.neighborhood_overview:
Chamberí is one of those neighbourhoods that has everything and also retains its traditional flavour. The Iglesia metro station is on our doorstep, just 3 stops from Gran Via and also, bus stops number, 61, 16, 3, 147, to move around on the surface if you prefer. From here you can reach the gastronomic area of Ponzano and the always lively Plaza de Olavide with its terraces.

A little further on is Calle Fuencarral, full of shops and cinemas.

If you like culture, the Pintor Sorolla Museum is just around the corner and the Archaeological Museum and the National Library are only a 15 minute walk away.

If you are passing through and are going to continue your travels in Spain, don't hesitate to let me know, as I know it very well and I can recommend amazing places in almost every major city in Spain.

I will be happy to make recommendations to make your stay in Madrid and in Spain, unforgettable.
results.host_about: Acostumbrado a viajar y habiendo vivido en países tan distantes como Australia, me considero un tipo abierto con buen sentido del humor y gran amigo de compartir mi espacio con gente interesante que ha visto en Airbnb una manera más autentica de viajar.

results.name: Elegant & Confortable apartment in the center
results.description: Situated in the exclusive neighbourhood of Barrio Salamanca, this 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom property is within walking distance of the best shops.
results.neighborhood_overview: Barrio Salamanca is considered one of the best neigbourhoods of Madrid, where all the embassies are found and most of the Embasadors live. Surrounded by boutiques such as Cartier, Hermes and Gucci it also hosts the best Restaurants and Bars making this area a haven to live in.
results.host_about:
Our small agency was created by two people: Karin Wallis, half English and half Swedish has lived most of her life in Madrid and Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano down to the marrow, has lived in Seville all of his life. We created the agency as we wish to do something different: take peoples charming homes and transform them into rentals, keeping the magic and charm the owners created when they built their home but at the same time making it comfortable and adequate for our clients such as  giving them plenty of empty cupboard space,  ensuring the only food in the fridge is the one of our welcome hamper and making sure everything is working correctly and is sparkling clean so that when you arrive, the property will feel like instant home to you too. There are no two properties alike, nor are there two guest exactly alike but we do trust we will have the right home for you.

Nuestra pequeña agncia fue creada por Karin Wallis, mitad inglesa y mitad sueca ha vivido casi toda su vida en Madrid y Nono de Barco, 100% Sevillano hasta la medula, ha vivido en Sevilla toda su vida. Creamos esta empresa dado que queríamos hacer algo diferente: transformar la acogedora casa de un propietario a una propiedad para alquilar manteniendo la magia y el encanto que los propietarios metieron en ella pero a su vez adecuándola para que sea cómodo para nuestros clientes. No hay dos propiedades  iguales, ni hay dos clientes exactamente iguales pero confiamos en tener una casa de su agrado.

results.host_about:
Alquilar apartamentos en Madrid nunca fue tan sencillo. 

Somos una empresa que se dedica desde hace más de 10 años al alquiler de viviendas para turistas y empresas, ofreciendo un servicio integral para hacer su estancia lo más cómoda y agradable posible. 

Todas nuestras viviendas están amuebladas con los electrodomesticos y utensilios necesarios para estar como en casa, además como podrás observar en nuestras fotos, los apartamentos han sido reformados recientemente y equipados con cariño y esmero. results.neighborhood_overview:
NEIGHBOURHOOD & LOCATION:

Here in the heart of Madrid’s city centre you are surrounded by a taste of grocery stores, tapas bars, like the famous Mercado de San Miguel and lots of conveniences.

This is the "Los Austrias Neighbourhood" Sol district, bordering with Las Letras Neighbourhood in Huertas neighbourhood or La Latina Neighbourhood.

You are under 5 minutes walk you arrive at Palacio Real, Opera or to the Km 0 at Puerta del Sol; the centre of Madrid and, in fact, the centre of Spain.

Nearby Metro station: Sol (L1, L2, L3)
Parking under the square Plaza Mayor.

results.host_about:
I live in Madrid but I'm from the Basque Country in the north of Spain. The city where I come from is Vitoria-Gasteiz and has been recognized as the European Green Capital. 
I lived in Los Angeles In 1997, then I moved to New York, Barcelona, and finally I ended up in Madrid, a beautifull city shinned almost everyday under a great blue sky!
I'm an actress and I also manage these very nice apartments from my friends actors and artists too.
I also love traveling around the world and meeting new people!!

results.name: Lujo a tu alcance
results.description: A quiet room, without the agglomerations of the center, with excellent views. Complete private bathroom. Comfortable and full of natural light, equipped with a large study table, ambient and reading lights, wardrobe, and plenty of room for your things! Nearby, places to eat or dine, and supermarkets in case you want to cook. The kitchen has all the kitchenware you need, vitro ceramic and dishwasher. You can also dine  on the terrace, watching the  Four Towers. The Bamboo metro station on line 1 takes you directly to the city centre, and a little further on, the Chamartin train station connects you to the commuter network.
results.neighborhood_overview: Es una zona muy tranquila. Tenemos cerca varias cafeterías-restaurante, tiendas de alimentación, unas pistas de paddel. Es un ambiente residencial, sin los agobios del centro de la ciudad!

results.name: ❤Quiet & Comfortable apartment downtown
results.description:
This modernly colourful apartment is an architects jewel. You will have privacy, silence and comfort right in the middle of Madrid. It is close to museums, restaurants and subway, access it through a wine tree covered patio: Open kitchen, living room, bedroom with one double or two twin beds, bathroom. WiFi. Cable TV. Landline phone.

NOT apt for INFANTS or PETS.
NOT ACCESSIBLE: There is NO LIFT, but 30 sturdy concrete steps.
results.neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at calle Olivar, one of the most quiet streets in Lavapies, which is a multi-cultural neighbourhood, full of exotic flavours, lively, safe, friendly, with all kinds of shops and supermarkets. Rent this self catering apartment in this exciting city and explore its artistic, architectural and gastronomic delights in style.

Alternative museums like Tabacalera, Casa Encendida, CaixaForum and Matadero are strung in a 15 minutes walk radius.
Brand new and highly recommendable is Madrid Rio: the 650 ha. large and 10 km long park alongside the Manzanares river, where cyclists and lovebirds meet skateboarders and dog-walkers.
